name: Bangunan Sultan Abdul Samad
architects: A.C. Norman, R.A.J. Bidwell, A.B. Hubback
info: Once the largest building of its day, this administrative centre cost $198,000 Straits Dollars to build. It used over 4 million bricks! The massive 140ft clock tower houses a one-ton bell that first chimed for Queen Victoria's birthday in 1897. Look for the granite bollards near the porch—they were originally used for tethering horses.

quiz.q: What was the cost of the building in Straits Dollars?

ai_context: Originally serving as the grand administrative center for the British, this iconic landmark is perhaps the most famous in Kuala Lumpur. Built with over 4 million bricks, it was the largest building of its time. **Don't Miss:** The imposing 41-meter clock tower, which houses a one-ton bell that first chimed for Queen Victoria's birthday in 1897. Also, look for the granite bollards near the porch—they were originally used for tethering horses.

name: Old Post Office
info: Built at a cost of $100,000 Straits Dollars, this Moghul-style structure served as KL's General Post Office until 1984. Designed by A.B. Hubback to match the Sultan Abdul Samad building, it features wide verandahs and pointed horse-shoe arches. It is now used by the Ministry of Tourism and Culture.
ai_context: Designed by A.B. Hubback to perfectly complement its famous neighbour, the Sultan Abdul Samad Building, this Moghul-style structure was KL's General Post Office until 1984. It showcases Hubback's signature style with its wide verandahs and elegant horse-shoe arches.

name: Wisma Straits Trading & Loke Yew Building
architects: B.M. Iversen (Loke Yew), A.K. Moosden (Chow Kit)
info: A cluster of commercial history. The Loke Yew Building is an iconic 6-storey Art Deco style structure designed by B.M. Iversen. Next door is the Neo-Renaissance style Chow Kit & Co. Building (1905), featuring Flemish pediments. These sites mark the empire established by early tin tycoons like Loke Yew.

quiz.q: The Loke Yew Building is a 6-storey ___ style structure.

ai_context: This cluster of buildings tells the story of Kuala Lumpur's commercial boom. The 6-storey Loke Yew Building is a famous example of the **Art Deco** style (a 1920s-30s style known for geometric forms). Next door, the Chow Kit & Co. building from 1905 shows off a Neo-Renaissance style. These buildings represent the empires built by early tin tycoons like Loke Yew.

name: Masjid Jamek
info: Built for $33,500 Straits Dollars at the confluence of the Klang and Gombak rivers. This Moghul-inspired mosque sits on an old Malay cemetery. Admire the red and white brick bands and the flooring, which uses original Doulton tiles designed in the pattern of prayer mats.

quiz.q: Masjid Jamek is located on the site of a Malay...

ai_context: Officially named Masjid Jamek Sultan Abdul Samad, this is one of KL's oldest mosques. It is built at the historic confluence of the Klang and Gombak rivers, the very birthplace of Kuala Lumpur. The mosque sits on the site of an old Malay **cemetery**. Its design features distinctive red and white brick bands.

name: Medan Pasar (Old Market Square)
info: The original town center of Kapitan Yap Ah Loy. The square is lined with ornate 1907 Neo-classical shophouses. In the center stands an Art Deco Clock Tower featuring a 'sunburst' motif, built in 1937 to commemorate the coronation of King George VI.

quiz.q: The 1937 Clock Tower commemorates the coronation of King ___ ___.

ai_context: This was the original town center established by Kapitan Yap Ah Loy. Today, the square is lined with ornate Neo-classical shophouses. Its centerpiece is the Art Deco Clock Tower, built in 1937 to commemorate the coronation of King **George VI**.

name: Sze Ya Temple
info: KL's oldest traditional Chinese temple, founded by Kapitan Yap Ah Loy. Uniquely, it sits at an angle to the road to follow Feng Shui principles. It is dedicated to the deities who guided Yap Ah Loy during the Civil War.

quiz.q: Who was the founder of the temple in 1864?

ai_context: As Kuala Lumpur's oldest traditional Chinese temple, its construction was funded by **Kapitan Yap Ah Loy**. It is uniquely angled away from the road to align with Feng Shui principles. The temple is dedicated to the patron deities Sin Sze Ya and Si Sze Ya, who are said to have guided the Kapitan to victory during the Selangor Civil War.

name: The Triangle (Old Federal Stores)
info: Located at the Bangkok Bank Triangle. The Old Federal Stores building is unique because it spans the entire block and has no 'five-foot way'. It features fanciful garlic-shaped finials and was once occupied by the founders of Cycle & Carriage, who imported the first cars into Malaya.

quiz.q: The unique Old Federal Stores building has no '___-foot way'.

ai_context: This building is highly unusual because it spans an entire triangular block and has no '**five**-foot way'. A 'five-foot way' is the name for the covered walkway found on the ground floor of most shophouses. This building's unique design omits it. **Look For:** The whimsical garlic-shaped finials on its roof.

name: Kedai Ubat Kwong Ban Heng
info: Step back in time at No. 62. Established over 30 years ago, this traditional medicine shop retains its original glass cabinets and fittings. It is a living museum where you can still buy traditional herbs for everything from coughs and digestion to stress relief.

quiz.q: This shop was established over how many years ago?

ai_context: A true step back in time. This traditional medicine shop was established over **30** years ago and still retains its original glass cabinets and fittings. It's a living museum where you can purchase traditional herbs.

name: Oriental Building
info: When built in 1932, this 85-foot Art Deco masterpiece was the tallest building in Kuala Lumpur! Designed by A.O. Coltman on a triangular site, it features a beautiful curved façade. It originally housed Radio Malaya and later served as a bank.

quiz.q: In 1932, this was the tallest building in KL, at ___ feet high.

ai_context: An Art Deco masterpiece. When it was completed in 1932, this **85**-foot structure was the tallest building in Kuala Lumpur. Designed by A.O. Coltman on a triangular plot, it has a beautiful curved facade and originally housed Radio Malaya.

name: Flower Garland Stalls
info: A feast for the senses located near the Teochew Association. Here you can watch artisans weaving traditional fresh flower garlands used for religious offerings and celebrations. You can learn how to make one, or just buy a bunch of flowers.

quiz.q: You can learn how to make a traditional flower ___.

ai_context: A vibrant and fragrant stop near the Teochew Association. Here, you can watch artisans skillfully weave traditional fresh flower **garland**s. These are used for religious offerings and celebrations. Visitors can learn the craft or simply buy some fresh flowers.

name: Masjid India
info: Started as a timber hut in 1893, the current Southern Indian style structure was opened in 1966 to hold 3,500 people. Unlike Masjid Jamek, services here are conducted in both Arabic and Tamil. The surrounding arcade is famous for textiles, spices, and religious items.

quiz.q: Prayer service is conducted in Arabic and ___.

ai_context: This area's first mosque was a simple timber hut from 1893. The current Southern Indian-style structure opened in 1966. A unique feature is that prayer services here are conducted in both Arabic and **Tamil**. The surrounding arcade is famous for its textiles and spices.

name: P.H. Hendry Royal Jewellers
info: Malaysia's oldest existing jewellers, founded by P.H. Hendry from Sri Lanka after he was shipwrecked en route to Australia! The family became so renowned they were appointed Royal Jewellers to three different Sultans (Selangor, Kelantan and Negeri Sembilan) in the 1920s.

quiz.q: P.H. Hendry was appointed royal jewellers to how many Sultans?

ai_context: Malaysia's oldest existing jewellers. It was founded by P.H. Hendry from Sri Lanka after he was shipwrecked! The family's craftsmanship was so renowned they were appointed Royal Jewellers to **3** different Sultans in the 1920s.

name: Panggong Bandaraya (Old City Hall)
info: Built for $107,000 Straits Dollars, this Moghul-style beauty housed the Municipal Offices and KL's only theatre auditorium. After surviving a major fire in the mid-1980s, it was restored as the Panggong Bandaraya. It is now the venue for the musical MUD: Our story of Kuala Lumpur.

quiz.q: The building was razed by ___ in the mid-1980s.

ai_context: This Moghul-style beauty originally housed the Municipal Offices and KL's only theatre. After being heavily damaged by a major **fire** in the mid-1980s, it was beautifully restored. It is now the venue for the musical *MUD: Our Story of Kuala Lumpur*.

name: Dataran Merdeka
info: The historic cricket 'Padang'. At midnight on August 31, 1957, the Union Jack was lowered here, marking independence. Features include a 100m tall flagpole (once the world's tallest) and a Victorian fountain imported from England in 1897 for $4,000.
ai_context: The historic cricket 'Padang'. At midnight on August 31, 1957, the Union Jack was lowered here, marking independence. Features include a 100m tall flagpole (once the world's tallest) and a Victorian fountain imported from England in 1897.

name: National Textile Museum
info: Originally the Railway Offices (Cost: $116,000), this building is a classic example of 'Blood and Bandage' brickwork (red and white bands). Designed by A.B. Hubback, it now houses a fascinating collection of Malaysian textiles.
ai_context: Originally built as the FMS Railway Offices, this is a classic example of 'Blood and Bandage' brickwork (alternating red brick and white plaster). Designed by A.B. Hubback, it now houses a fascinating collection of Malaysian textiles.

name: OCBC Building
info: A 1936 Art Deco gem by A.O. Coltman. It was innovatively designed with a basement bicycle garage! Look up to see the stepped pylon and a mosaic panel featuring a Chinese Junk ship, the bank's original logo.
ai_context: An Art Deco gem designed by A.O. Coltman. It was very modern for its time, featuring a basement bicycle garage. **Look For:** The mosaic panel high on the building's facade, which features a Chinese Junk ship—the bank's original logo.

name: Central Market (Pasar Seni)
info: Built in 1936 as the wholesale wet market for $330,000. It used special 'Calorex' glass to keep the interior cool, saving the city from needing refrigerators! In 1986, it was converted into the award-winning arts market.
ai_context: Built in 1936 as the wholesale wet market. It used special 'Calorex' glass to keep the interior cool, saving the city from needing refrigerators! In 1986, it was converted into the award-winning arts market.

name: Jalan Yap Ah Loy
info: A short street with huge history. This road originally led directly to the home of Kapitan Yap Ah Loy. It joins Jalan Hang Lekiu (formerly Klyne Street), which was once one of the only paved streets in the city.
ai_context: A short street with huge history. This road originally led directly to the home of Kapitan Yap Ah Loy. It joins Jalan Hang Lekiu (formerly Klyne Street), which was once one of the only paved streets in the city.

name: Lebuh Ampang
info: Historically the street of the Chettiars (money-lenders). Look closely at No. 85—it features beautiful ceramic peacock tiles. The peacock is the symbol of Lord Muruga, the deity of the Chettiar caste.
ai_context: Historically the street of the Chettiars (money-lenders). **Look For:** The beautiful ceramic peacock tiles at building No. 85. The peacock is a symbol of Lord Muruga, the deity of the Chettiar caste.

name: Jalan Melaka
info: A mix of old and new. Notable for the Bank Muamalat building, which was designed to look like a traditional Malay House despite being a modern banking hall. The Malay school was originally located in this area.
ai_context: A mix of old and new. Notable for the Bank Muamalat building, which was designed to look like a traditional Malay House despite being a modern banking hall.

name: Selangor Mansion & Malayan Mansion
info: Completed in 1964 for $2.5 million, these 8-storey blocks were an early experiment in mass public housing for the newly independent nation. They replaced the former squatters of Lorong Gombak.
ai_context: Completed in 1964, these 8-storey blocks were an early experiment in mass public housing for the newly independent nation, replacing the former squatters of Lorong Gombak.

name: Wisma Yakin
info: Built in the 1970s, this tower was once the tallest in the area. It remains the absolute best place in the city to buy traditional Malay attire like Baju Melayu and Songkok (visit Stall 11 to meet En Zolfadli, the expert).
ai_context: Built in the 1970s, this tower was once the tallest in the area. It remains the best place in the city to buy traditional Malay attire like Baju Melayu and Songkok.

name: Jalan Melayu
info: Known as 'Malay Street', this area was once filled with spice factories and bakeries. Look for the 100-year-old business selling 'Kain Pelekat' (sarongs) at No 3-5, run by the Kulasingam Chettiar family since 1895.
ai_context: Known as 'Malay Street', this area was once filled with spice factories. Look for the 100-year-old business selling 'Kain Pelekat' (sarongs) at No 3-5, run by the Kulasingam Chettiar family since 1895.

name: Batu Road (Jalan TAR)
info: Now Jalan Tuanku Abdul Rahman, this was originally just a track leading to the tin mines at Batu Caves. The stunning block of shophouses here (built 1912-1915) features giant pilasters and decorative plaster garlands.
ai_context: Now Jalan Tuanku Abdul Rahman, this was originally a track leading to the tin mines at Batu Caves. The stunning block of shophouses here (built 1912-1915) features giant pilasters and decorative plaster garlands.

name: Old Survey Office
info: Another A.B. Hubback design built for $150,000. It features a dramatic 400ft long arcade. Look for the twin 'Chatris' (domed pavilions) on the roof. It sits sadly beneath the modern LRT line but remains a stunning piece of architecture.
ai_context: Another masterpiece by A.B. Hubback, this building features a dramatic 400-foot-long arcade. **Look For:** The twin 'Chatris' on the roof. A 'Chatri' is a small, elevated, dome-shaped pavilion, a common feature in Indian-inspired architecture.

name: Old High Court
info: Costing $208,000, this 1915 building replaced the courts on the hill. It features a grand inner courtyard and was designed by—you guessed it—A.B. Hubback. It is currently awaiting restoration by Kraftangan Malaysia.
ai_context: This 1915 building replaced the courts on the hill. It features a grand inner courtyard and was designed by A.B. Hubback. It is currently awaiting restoration by Kraftangan Malaysia.
